data.title: Binary redistribution with Chocolatey package
data.body:
While Visual Studio Code source code is available under MIT license, the binary product is not and has its [own license](https://code.visualstudio.com/License/) which disallows binary redistribution.

I'm maintaining the [Visual Studio Code Chocolatey Package](https://chocolatey.org/packages/VisualStudioCode) which currently downloads the installer from the website and runs it afterwards. This makes the package dependent on having an internet connection though, and also might be an issue in an enterprise environment. While Chocolatey Business Edition supports internalization of packages it would be easier if we were allowed to package and redeploy the Visual Studio Code installer in the package available from the Chocolatey community feed. 

Would it be possible to get permission to redeploy the installer directly with the Chocolatey package?

data.title: VSCode can't find binaries in my path (eslint)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Archlinux

Hi,

I have some binaries such as eslint, jshint or tslint in a user defined binary directory (`/home/user/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/.bin/`).
This directly is added to the `PATH` at session startup and is visible to vscode.
I checked in the `/proc/pid/environ` file of my running vscode (actually I checked the process that run the jshint server as well as the one for the workspace) that it has the PATH environment variable correctly set.

Still, when I open a `.js` file, I get the following message:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/160975/21218484/1ff5b948-c2b1-11e6-8a80-b84be1f166c9.png)

It is the same for eslint:
```
[Info  - 10:21:51] ESLint server is running.
[Info  - 10:21:51] 
Failed to load the ESLint library for the document /home/vnoel/Linagora/Petals/dev/git/petals-cockpit-new/frontend/generate-headers.js

To use ESLint in this workspace please install eslint using 'npm install eslint' or globally using 'npm install -g eslint'.
You need to reopen the workspace after installing eslint.
```

Surprisingly I don't have the problem with tslint even though it is in the same path…

data.title: Add a setting to disable Auto-Detection of High Contrast
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Windows Version 6.3.9600 (Windows 8.1 Enterprise)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enable High Contrast on Windows
2. Start VS Code, look at the glorious High Contrast theme
3. Select a different theme, because you would rather work in that
4. Restart VS Code, your theme choice gets overridden.

Essentially, I'd like to be able to disable the auto-detection of the High Contrast theme I'm using in Windows via some setting, because while I prefer Windows in High Contrast mode, I dislike looking at VS Code's High Contrast theme.

data.title: Add hotkey to step through search results
data.body: In Visual Studio you can step through search results with F8. It would be nice to have a similar functionality in VS Code. Right now you have to click with the mouse, which is slow and cumbersome.

data.title: Allow to open zip archives in Explorer
data.body: It would be very nice and helpful if i can just click on zip archive in explorer and see all of the beautiful files in it :)

data.title: Softwrap for markdown
data.body: I find it very hard to edit markdown files. There is no softwrap that makes the line continue on the next line if it's "overflowing" the current line. You have to scroll right, which is not the most UX friendly option.

data.title: Make CommandPalette position configurable
data.body:
[UX] [Feature request]

Would be very nice for the command palette position to be configurable.
By default, SublimeText places the palette on the tab column which is focused.

VS Code does not, and I don't know of a way to do that. It's oftentimes confusing to see it centered when you access some commands related to the currently focused tab/editor.

**SublimeText**
![screenshot 2016-12-15 10 24 42](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/196656/21216913/14b1e682-c2b2-11e6-9ba4-d90802f88d7a.png)


**VSCode**
![screenshot 2016-12-15 10 24 53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/196656/21216917/1a7266aa-c2b2-11e6-951d-610bf83d4e08.png)

Notice how nicely Sublime positions the command palette on the focused tab - which is very nice.

data.title: Accessibility:MAS36: Not able to navigate to the view bar options  in the "vs code editor" using "Tab" key for the first time.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open visual studio code editor.
2.Using "Tab", key try to navigate to the "viewbaroptions (Explorer, Search, Git, Debug and Extensions)"


**Expected result:**
User should be able to navigate to all the "view bar options" using "Tab" key for the first time.

**Actual Result:**
User is not able to navigate to the view bar options using "Tab", key.User has to travel a lot using "Tab",key to reach view bar options. 

**User Impact:**
User might wouldn't able to Navigate to View Bar without using short cut keys for the first time.

**Attachments:**
![vscodeditor_viewbaroptions](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21215261/16785f3c-c2c6-11e6-84cb-4cf138172287.jpg)

data.title: Accessibility:MAS42A: Color is the Only Way of Indicating Changes made in a File.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607


**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open visual studio code editor.
2. Open any file and using "Ctrl+1" key  navigate to the first vs code editor.
3. Using F1 key navigate to the palette, type "git branch" and "refactor-to-promise" as the branch name
4. Make changes to the code by refactoring, adding/deleting new lines ; observe any Alternative Text Description available for blue/green/red indicators suggesting if code has been changed/new line added/line has been removed.
5. Compare the changes between the HEAD and current file by navigating to View Bar ---> Git ; Navigate to changes and hit ENTER to activate "Diff View" ; Observe any Alternative Test Description available to parse code.

**Expected result:**
Alternative Text Description for these Color Indications should be there

**Actual Result:**
1. Red color Indicates -> No of lines Deleted,
Blue Color Indicates-> No of Lines edited,
Green Color Indicates->No of New Lines Added
2. Red color Indicates how the code was Originally and Green Color Indicates how the Code got changed to

**User Impact:**
Blind users might not be knowing these changes as Color is the Only Way of Indicating Changes made in a File.

**Attachments:**
![color is the only way of describing a new line is added or line is deleted and line is edited](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21215183/7d3674f8-c2c5-11e6-80b0-b29862384b05.jpg)
![color is the only way of describing changes made on which line](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21215182/7d34572c-c2c5-11e6-9678-70f94bbf5bc8.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting any information after a Git Branch is changed.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2. Open any file and using "Ctrl+1" key  navigate to the first vs code editor.
3. Using F1 key navigate to the palette, type "git branch" and "refactor-to-promise" as the branch name and Hit Enter and observe NVDA announcement.

**Expected result:**
NVDA should provide information after a Git Branch is changed.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not reciting any information after a Git Branch is changed
Note: NVDA Speech Viewer is added in the Screenshot

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know whether the Git Branch is changed or Not.

**Attachments:**
![nvda is not reciting any information after a git branch is changed](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21215064/c6376cb2-c2c4-11e6-8a69-2d43f9f0188a.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA announces irrelavant information after opening the Git output pane.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2. Open any file and using "Ctrl+1" key  navigate to the first vs code editor.
3. Using F1 key navigate to the palette, type "git branch" and "refactor-to-promise" as the branch name
4. Make changes to the code by refactoring, adding/deleting new lines
5. Compare the changes between the HEAD and current file by navigating to View Bar ---> Git ; Navigate to changes and hit ENTER to activate "Diff View" 
6. Stage and commit the changes under View Bar ---> Git  ; Navigate to the "Commit Staged"  button and hit ENTER to make a commit
7. Undo the commit by navigating to the toggle button (same row as commit staged), hit ENTER and use down ARROW to choose "Undo Last Commit" option 
8. Navigate to "More Button" in Git Side Bar and Hit Enter.
9. Navigate to "Show Git Output" and Hit Enter and observe NVDA announcement

**Expected result:**
NVDA should announce Proper Information regarding the output of the Git after opening the output pane.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA announces irrelevant information after opening the output pane
1. NVDA announces as "Pane unavailable; index.html (HEAD)<->index.html - yesho - Visual studio code document; note; Git actions toolbar; Pane unavailable; index.html (HEAD)<->index.html - yesho - Visual studio code document; note; Git actions toolbar;"

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user gets confused if NVDA announces irrelevant information after opening the output pane

Attachments:
![nvda announces irrelavant information after opening the output pane](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214979/28b9d452-c2c4-11e6-8727-0b6664de1f7a.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting any information after a file is committed or Undo Last Commit is Invoked.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2. Open any file and using "Ctrl+1" key  navigate to the first vs code editor.
3. Using F1 key navigate to the palette, type "git branch" and "refactor-to-promise" as the branch name
4. Make changes to the code by refactoring, adding/deleting new lines
5. Compare the changes between the HEAD and current file by navigating to View Bar ---> Git ; Navigate to changes and hit ENTER to activate "Diff View" 
6. Stage and commit the changes under View Bar ---> Git  ; Navigate to the "Commit Staged" or "commit All"  button and hit ENTER to make a commit and observe NVDA announcement
7. Undo the commit by navigating to the toggle button (same row as commit staged), hit ENTER and use down ARROW to choose "Undo Last Commit" option and observe NVDA announcement.

**Expected result:**
NVDA should provide information after a file is committed or Undo Last Commit is Invoked

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not reciting any information after a file is committed or Undo Last Commit is Invoked

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know whether the file is committed or not and 'Undo Last commit' is successful or not.

**Attachments:**
![nvda is not reciting any information after a file is committed through commit all](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214883/8d729c86-c2c3-11e6-9f91-9d94e2d7328a.jpg)
![nvda is not reciting any information after a file is committed through commit staged](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214882/8d70697a-c2c3-11e6-8ba2-59a58266c36a.jpg)
![nvda is not reciting any information after undo last commit is invoked](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214881/8d6fca4c-c2c3-11e6-9841-fad17be77e26.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting any information when a New line is added or an exisitng line edited or deleted and fails to recite about the changes between original file and changed file.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open visual studio code editor.
2. Open any file and using "Ctrl+1" key  navigate to the first vs code editor.
3. Using F1 key navigate to the palette, type "git branch" and "refactor-to-promise" as the branch name
4. Make changes to the code by refactoring, adding/deleting new lines ; observe NVDA announcement for blue/green/red indicators suggesting if code has been changed/new line added/line has been removed.
5. Compare the changes between the HEAD and current file by navigating to View Bar ---> Git ; Navigate to changes and hit ENTER to activate "Diff View" ; observe NVDA announcement to parse code.

**Expected result:**
NVDA should provide information when a New line is added or an existing line edited or deleted, it just reads the user interpretation
2. NVDA should recite about the changes between original file and changed file

**Actual Result:**
1. NVDA is not reciting any information when a New line is added or an existing line edited or deleted, it just reads the user interpretation
2. NVDA fails to recite about the changes between original file and changed file

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know when a New line is added or an existing line edited or deleted and about the changes between original file and changed file

**Attachments:**
![nvda fails to recite about the changes between original file and changed file](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214699/6c5874fe-c2c2-11e6-8bd1-f1dabc15e486.jpg)
![nvda is not reciting any information when a new line is added or an exisitng line edited or deleted it just reads the user interpretation](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214698/6c574c82-c2c2-11e6-9d1f-44ac9e462a7b.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting any information when two brackets are matched or after changing multiple occurance or after folding/unfolding.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open VS code editor.
2.Navigate to one of the editor.
3. Navigate to a Bracket present in the file and see the matched bracket highlighted and observe NVDA announcement.
4. Navigate to the Name which you want to change and Press Options button or Right Click and select Change all Occurrences and Hit Enter and change the Name to Desired Name and observe NVDA announcement.
(Note- Options key is available only in Personal Computer and Not on Laptops)
5. Press f1 and type "Fold" or "Unfold "command in command pallet and Hit Enter and observe NVDA announcement.

**Expected result:**
NVDA should provide information when two brackets are matched or after changing multiple occurrence or after folding/unfolding

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not reciting any information when two brackets are matched or after changing multiple occurrence or after folding/unfolding.
Observation: NVDA announces the command written ">fold" in command pallet when Keyboard focus goes to the options Displayed by Command Pallet

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know when two brackets are matched or after changing multiple occurrence or after folding/unfolding.

**Attachments:**
![nvda announces the command in the command pallete for all options displayed by command pallete](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214623/e0092c00-c2c1-11e6-9aab-ef8336e47e6f.jpg)
![nvda is not reciting any information after changing multiple occurance](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214625/e00faa1c-c2c1-11e6-8973-53b08404b9fd.jpg)
![nvda is not reciting any information after folding a file](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214626/e012f4ce-c2c1-11e6-9123-b7fdebd1dc72.jpg)
![nvda is not reciting any information after unfolding a file](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214624/e00a4ea0-c2c1-11e6-9574-26c50fd19abd.jpg)
![nvda is not reciting any information when two brackets are matched](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214622/e00713c0-c2c1-11e6-9662-b45e1bd915f7.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting the names for the errors and warnings present in the errors and warning panel on Navigation.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open VS code editor.
2.Navigate to one of the editor.
3.Press"Ctrl+Shift+M" to open the errors and warnings panel.
4. Using "Down Arrow" navigate to the errors and warnings.
5. Observe the NVDA behavior.
6. Fix the errors and observe visually the status changed in Errors and Warnings panel.
7. observe NVDA behavior.
8. Now Press "Ctrl+Shift+M" twice to reopen the panel and observe the NVDA behavior.

**Expected result:**
1. NVDA should provide information about the errors and warnings present in the panel on Navigation
2. NVDA should recite information regarding the fix of errors as soon as the status is changed in the Errors and Warnings Panel without reopening of panel

**Actual Result**:
Issue1: NVDA is not providing any information about the errors and warnings present in the panel on Navigation. On hitting Ctrl+Shift+M, NVDA  announces as "Problems grouped by Tree file view".
Narrator Behavior:
Narrator announces the Name and Details on Capslock+Arrow key Navigation
Issue 2: NVDA is reciting information regarding the fix of errors unless the panel is reopened
Narrator Behavior:
Narrator is not announcing the message even after reopening the Panel

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know about the available Errors and Warnings and doesn't know whether they are fixed or not as no announcement after fixing

**Attachments:**
![nvda is not announcing information when errors are fixed](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214498/063a5706-c2c1-11e6-94ac-ca5918f16802.jpg)
![nvda is not announcing the error names and details](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214500/063e2926-c2c1-11e6-98c8-578d23b7d515.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting  names for the options available for replace preview results.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: Node.js and git repository need to be installed.
1.Open VS code editor.
2.Navigate to the "Search" side bar area.
3.Enter the  word that need to be searched in the "search" edit box and press "enter" key.
4.Enter the word that need to be replaced in the "Replace" edit box and press "enter" key to show results.

**Expected result:**
1.NVDA should recite the complete word that was entered for search and replace.
2.NVDA should read out the names for all the results available in the replace preview results. 

**Actual Result:**
1.NVDA is not reciting entire word that was  entered for search and replace.
2.NVDA is only reciting the name for the first result and no narration for all other results available in the replace preview results.
Narrator Behavior:
Narrator is properly Reciting the Replace Results (See Screenshot)

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know about the available Replace Preview Results.

**Attachments:**
![nvda_speechviewerinformation_vscodeeditor_searchreplace](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214370/63a424d6-c2c0-11e6-8304-b8e3104a56d7.jpg)
